Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water, showing it with strong, healthy leaves and stems.
The student can draw a plant without water, illustrating it with wilted, dry, or drooping parts.
The student can include the sun in the drawing to show that plants also need light to live and grow.
The student can depict different states of plant health in the drawings to indicate the presence or absence of water.
The student can use arrows or labels to show that plants without water or light cannot live or grow.
